parameters.definition: Units of nitrogen per kg of fertilizer A
Units of phosphoric acid per kg of fertilizer A
Units of vitamin A per kg of fertilizer A
Units of vitamin D per kg of fertilizer A
Units of nitrogen per kg of fertilizer B
Units of phosphoric acid per kg of fertilizer B
Units of vitamin A per kg of fertilizer B
Units of vitamin D per kg of fertilizer B
Minimum required units of nitrogen for the plant nutrition
Minimum required units of phosphoric acid for the plant nutrition
Maximum allowed units of vitamin A for the plant nutrition

description: A farmer wants to manufacture a special plant nutrition using fertilizers A and B. Each kg of fertilizer A contains \param{NitrogenA} units of nitrogen, \param{PhosphoricA} units of phosphoric acid, \param{VitaminAA} units of vitamin A and \param{VitaminDA} units of vitamin D. Each kg of fertilizer B contains \param{NitrogenB} units of nitrogen, \param{PhosphoricB} units of phosphoric acid, \param{VitaminAB} units of vitamin A and \param{VitaminDB} units of vitamin D. To be effective, the plant nutrition requires a minimum \param{MinNitrogen} units of nitrogen, a minimum of \param{MinPhosphoric} units of phosphoric acid, and no more than \param{MaxVitaminA} units of vitamin A. How many kg of each fertilizer should be used to minimize the amount of vitamin D in the nutrition? What is the minimum amount of vitamin D?
